WebRTC Monitor

Stream Monitor

What's WebRTC Monitor?

It's a simple web app to monitor (watch and listen) a remote location in real time.

How does it work?

You open one web browser in Stream Mode and press to copy the URL of the web page where you will be able to see your stream, the Monitor Mode.
Then open another web browser in Monitor mode and paste the channel UUID.
That's it. You should be able to get real time video from the streamer.
In other words, WebRTC Monitor leverages WebRTC technology to let you remotely connect to another browser, in peer to peer fashion, and access its shared media stream, audio and video.

Privacy

When you start streaming a new UUID is automatically generated for you.
It's not likely that someone would be able to get your UUID by brute forcing it, because there are too many possible combinations.
But, I wouldn't recommend using this tool to stream sensitive content.
